title: Two fragments of a late antique inscription
support: Two non-joining fragments of an off-white limestone. Fragment (a) is cut-down into a rectangular block; fragment (b) broken on all sides. Both only roughly finished on the reverse. Fragment (a) is H 26.5 cm x W 15 cm x D 14.5 cm; fragment (b) is H 17cm x W 30.5 cm x D 17 cm. Both fragment have a simple raised moulding bordering the text down the right margin.

layout.p: Line 1 of fragment (a) is slightly larger than the other lines.

handNote.lettering: Distinctively U shaped flat-bottomed channels for the letter strokes, with flat strokes/serifs across the top of the alpha, but otherwise without serifs. Lunate sigma and epsilon, uncial omega, broken and straight barred alpha; kappa with short arms.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Gabriele Judica
museum.description: This museum displays the part of the Barone Judica collection that was previously in Lentini. Mostly unprovenanced, it is well-displayed in a well-restored building. Mostly thought to come from Akrai itself. The ceramics are of good quality, but heavily abraded. 6 stone inscriptions plus a terracotta altar & a charcoal inscription on ceramic.

location.address: Palazzo Cappellani, Via Gaetano Italia - Palazzolo Acreide (SR)
